definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: The black horse screamed loudly, a cry of fear.
sentences.chinese: 黑駿馬大聲嘶叫起來，那是一種充滿恐懼的叫喊。

sentences.english: There, the wind carried a whiff from the cheeses full on to our steed.
sentences.chinese: 風把一股子奶酪的氣味直吹向我們的駿馬。

sentences.english: And, trembling like a steed before the start.
sentences.chinese: 象出發前的駿馬，總有些戰慄。

sentences.english: His magnificent horse outlook all the others in the race.
sentences.chinese: 駿馬比參賽的其它所有的馬都要好看。

sentences.english: The courser in the picture means succeeding immediately upon its arrival.
sentences.chinese: 圖中的駿馬寓意着“馬到成功”。

sentences.english: Bole to immediately determine from the voice, which is a rare horse.
sentences.chinese: 伯樂立即從聲音中判斷出，這是一匹難得的駿馬。

sentences.english: A fine horse is running fast on the grassy plain.
sentences.chinese: 一匹駿馬在大草原上奔馳。

sentences.english: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.
sentences.chinese: 我的佳偶，我將你比法老車上套的駿馬。

sentences.english: The third category is songs praising fine horses and grassland, like The Hailiu Horse Aged Four.
sentences.chinese: 三是讚美駿馬和草原，如《四歲的海騮馬》等。

sentences.english: Yes, your legs, like horses' dancing on the green grass.
sentences.chinese: 不錯，你的腿，像綠草地上的駿馬的舞蹈。

sentences.english: He gained the First and the Second national literary "Horse Award".
sentences.chinese: 先後獲全國第一屆和第二屆文學“駿馬獎”。

sentences.english: Sturdy steeds gallop on the grasslands.
Those who ride donkeys long for stallions.
Time, Bole by Chu's mandate and accommodation, buying on line can be dry inside the horse.
sentences.chinese: 一次，伯樂受楚王的委託，購買能日行幹裏的駿馬。

sentences.english: She'll be as good as Black Eeauty one day, 'replied John.
sentences.chinese: “有一天她會變得和黑駿馬一樣出色的，”約翰說。

sentences.english: Let me turn the beautiful steed, gallops with you in the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 讓我變成美麗的駿馬，和你馳騁在天涯。

definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to soar/to rise high into the air
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
armored horse/cavalry/metal chimes hanging from eaves/steel barricade/(Tw) bike
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
oxen and horses/beasts of burden/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
